com.esri.mo2.ui.toc
Class TreeToc

java.lang.Object

              +--javax.swing.JComponent

                    +--javax.swing.JTree
                          |
                          +--com.esri.mo2.ui.toc.TreeTocDragDropImpls
                                |
                                +--com.esri.mo2.ui.toc.TreeToc
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accessible, Autoscroll, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Scrollable, Serializable
public class TreeToc
extends TreeTocDragDropImpls

A Toc is a table of contents(TOC) for a Map with a tree-style organization. A Toc consists of one or more data frame(s). A data frame represents a geographic area under a projection with a series of layers. Each layer in the map is represented by one LegendNode object. Each LegendNode usually consists of zero or more SymbolLeafNode objects. A SymbolLeafNode is a leaf node within a Toc which cannot have any child nodes. However, a LegendNode can have another LegendNode as its child, depenedending on the layer type it represents. A single Toc has at least one data frame, and only one data frame can be "active" at any given time.

A LegendNode responds to different mouse events as follows:

  • Single click on the label: toggle the selection of the node.
  • Single click on the checkbox: toggle the layer visibility.
  • Right single click: show the popup menu if the node is a feature node.

    • Once you create a Toc object, you have to associate it with a Map. Internally, a Toc has a LayerListener which listens to the changes of the map contents.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    refresh

    public void refresh()
    Refreshes the contents of Toc. It goes through each LegendNode and reconstrcut them if necessary. It will call the
    refresh(LegendNode legendNode)
    method.
    It also call invalidateToc and reloadToc methods.

    See Also:
    refresh(LegendNode legendNode)

    refresh

    public void refresh(LegendNode node)
    Reconstruct a specific LegendNode if necessary in case the Layer the node represents has changed some properties, such as renderer, symbol, or color etc.

    Parameters:
    node - node

    public LegendNode createLegendNode(Layer layer)

    setLegendOutOfScaleBehaviour

    public void setLegendOutOfScaleBehaviour(int type)
    Provide a way to change the behaviour of displaying/enabling Legends when their associated Layer is no longer within a scale dependency range.

    Parameters:
    type -
    0 == (default) the Legend becomes invisible when out of scale,
    1 == the Legend becomes disabled but still visible,
    2 == the Legend remains both visible and enabled
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if type is not one of these values
    See Also:
    Layer.isOutOfScaleRange(double)

    getLegendOutOfScaleBehaviour

    public int getLegendOutOfScaleBehaviour()
    Obtain the current behaviour type for Legends that go out of scale.

    Returns:
    the behaviour type
    See Also:
    setLegendOutOfScaleBehaviour(int)

    addDataFrame

    public final DataFrame addDataFrame()
    Adds a new DataFrame to the current TOC. Internally the method will add a new DataFrameNode to the toc, and have the node be active DataFrameNode.

    Returns:
    a newly created DataFrameNode object.

    removeDataFrame

    public void removeDataFrame()
